page.title: 16AN OLD LADY FROM TONBRIDGE:2
page.content: "When I was 9 years old in 1917 I lived in a 2 bedroomed house in Ton- bridge.The house was lit by oil lamps and our water came from a well in the back garden. "My name was Ada Yates then.My father was killed in the 1914-18 war so my mother had to do more and more work every day with 6 children to bring up. "I had a very close friend the same age as me who lived in London and we wrote to each other nearly every day. What with the war,and money being short,our letters took a long time to get to each other.One day she wrote to me and said that in her road a Zepp- elin had made a hole the size of a bus.Now I am over 70 I like to have a lie-in late in the mornings.I live with just my husband.Our daughter is married and has moved away.She often comes and helps with the shopping."
